ğŸ”´ Most people get in the red for two reasons: they #fomo rush or do not realize their risk has increased!

Go slow.
Keep this heuristic in mind.
Ask yourself, "How has my risk increased?"

ğŸ›ï¸ Decentralizing a DAO or Protocol? 

ğŸ¦¹ Risks: Does the DAO control a large treasury or other resources? How easy would a governance attack be given governing power liquidity?
ğŸ¦¸ Defense: Decentralize slowly as you ensure proper controls are in place!

ğŸ‘‘ Becoming popular in web3? Leading a DAO or project?

ğŸ¦¹ Risks: Your inherent risk is increasing! Be ready for phishing attacks!
ğŸ¦¸ Defense: Harden your accounts w/ MFA. Avoid clicking on links. Let collaborators know how to make sure they are talking to you.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ Need to connect a wallet to a site?

ğŸ¦¹ Risks: Which account are you using? What's in that account? How are you connecting?
ğŸ¦¸ Defense: Is the site well-known and audited? Can you use a clean account?

ğŸª™ You joined crypto and are collecting more assets!

ğŸ¦¹ Risks: Your risk is increasing! What wallet are you using? Where did you store your private key?
ğŸ¦¸ Defense: Buy a hardware wallet. Transfer assets if you stored your key insecurely.

ğŸ”´ is the danger zone! You have not protected yourself and are at risk of losing funds!

ğŸ”µ is wasted effort! You are over-protected and could be creating other issues!

Instead, match your actions with your risk. Let's take a look! https://t.co/KBjg4r6grQ

The heuristic is powered by a very simple principle: as your risk increases, your protection against the risk should also increase.

ğŸŸ¢ is good! https://t.co/PdRRBRRbxy

The risk v. maturity heuristic and how it can keep you safe in crypto!

@NadavAHollander Will OpenSea add token approvals displaying and revoking functionality?
@DavionTheDK @Dreamtourich @vvooter @isotile @rj Yes, was answering the question but should have clarified. Thatâ€™s why you revoke!

@Dreamtourich @DavionTheDK @vvooter @isotile @rj By definition, you cannot remove signatures. A signature is just signing a message with your private key, which is easily provable to have been signed by you. Once itâ€™s out there, itâ€™s impossible to take it back.
I joke - get rid of that stuff.
I am really against accredited investor gatekeeping. And then I remember all the people in the @feiprotocol discord ahead of launch preaching to pre-swap 100% to TRIBE ğŸ¥´

@dfinzer @dfinzer But the thing that is a bit disingenuous here is that the entire attack vector is opened bc users sign away token approvals to OS like itâ€™s nothing. @opensea has a responsibility to better show approvals and the revoke process. @econoar @iamDCinvestor @DCLBlogger

Token approvals are crazy. They just are. In a low gas environment, the flow is different. It shouldnâ€™t be â€œnormalâ€ to grant unlimited transfer approvals. Weâ€™ve got to come up with better ways to manage this.

@vvooter @isotile @rj Itâ€™s the combination of you granting someone access to transfer tokens (what you do first when you create an OS listing - costs gas) and this sale signature.

The hacker takes the phished signature to OS and says look - he sold this to me. OS executes the trade on your â€œbehalfâ€
@pmarca @APompliano Stability with hits of volatility is how we go about it!

@resoremo @iamDCinvestor @thomasg_eth Right, and â€œwashingâ€ here is referring to public traceability. Itâ€™s still linked in the exchangeâ€™s DB. But now the public loses track of the coins as they mix with the exchange holdings.

So, completely legal as a govt could still track via exchange records.

ğŸ‘† I have opened a pull request to create a clean, separate ERC-721 strategy for this use case. The unintuitive use of the current strategy is slowing adoption.

See my PR here: https://t.co/yieF0QMxdv

ğŸ‘† This strategy is great for communities/protocols using NFTs as initial "access tokens," which we will continue to see ğŸ”‘.

It is not as great when you do not want equal voting power across holders but want those with more skin-in-the-game holding more voting power ğŸ’.

ğŸ‘† Luckily, the `erc20-with-balance` strategy still resolves for ERC-721 tokens.

How it works ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ«

The strategy checks if your address has a balance `greater than` a minimum balance. If so, you get 1 voting power ğŸ’ªğŸ».

By leaving the minimum balance as 0, any holder gets 1 VP! https://t.co/yTaU9OZyuY

At @developer_dao, we have used a snapshot strategy that gives equal voting power across NFT holders ğŸ™ŒğŸ». Here's the rundown for other communities wanting to do the same!

The strategy is currently called `erc20-with-balance`, which is confusing ğŸ¤”. NFTs are ERC-721s! https://t.co/FTWTXoxBOd

Personally, I believe the exciting thing is that the values & principles set out by the innovators of crypto and decentralization will win out.

The principles around the blockchain trilemma, decentralization, and user ownership will win out.

But this is not guaranteed.

This is healthy conflict as we all weigh the importance of decentralization and usability.

What innovators must realize is that the values have to win for adoption. Values are not always adopted for value-sake.

Many of the debates seem to be natural conflict that arises as we progress up the s-curve.

Itâ€™s important for the innovators to voice the values that got us here. Itâ€™s important for the new adopters to build usable solutions.

I believe many of the current intra-web3 â€œdebatesâ€ can be summarized with this statement from @cdixon.

I often see these two groups of adopters talking past each other. One group focused on the values, another on the solutions. https://t.co/2LmMCHIsYv
